programmes.show_description: MGYB / Yamaha / Quattro: Derek gives the once-over to a Royale Formula Ford race car, and Paul is on a marathon trip to pick up a 1953 MGYB, a Moggy Van, and an '80s Yamaha 250RD motorbike.
The Battle of San Pietro: Exploring Italian ruins immortalised by Hollywood, a crumbling Chilean city with two lives and a brutalist Scottish relic whose prayers went unanswered.
Divine Intervention: Exploring a luxury resort that conceals a top-secret facility, a mysterious complex in Bali struck by disaster, and a relic of hope near Jerusalem.

programmes.show_name: True Evil: The Making Of A Nazi
programmes.show_description: Hermann Goering: A profile of Hermann Goering - the dashing, young, down-on-his-luck war veteran who turned into an extravagant, heartless, obese, drug-addled Nazi billionaire.
Shopping from Home.
Minnesota - Wisconsin: Michael Portillo journeys along the Upper Mississippi to Red Wing, Minnesota, and the home of Laura Ingalls Wilder, author of Little House on the Prairie.
Milwaukee to Chicago: Michael Portillo travels through Milwaukee on a journey towards Chicago, where he learns about the history of the iconic American Harley Davidson motorcycle.
Merc G-Wagon/Opel Manta: There's an unlikely arrival at the North Yorkshire car auction - an Argentinian Army Mercedes G wagon that saw action in the Falklands War.
Escort Cosworth/Daimler: Derek has three scooters to collect, while also finding room for a Daimler and a teardrop caravan.
German Aviation: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.
Men on the March: The complete story of World War I - from outbreak to conclusion - told through illuminating figures. Hear how an assassination brought conflict to Europe in 1914.
Castle Howard 2: Fiona Bruce presents from Castle Howard in North Yorkshire, where items brought in include a rare jade Buddha and a collection of First World War aviation paintings.
Floors Castle 1: Fiona Bruce hosts the show from Floors Castle in Kelso, with items assessed including Murano glass, a collection of jewellery and a rare book signed by JRR Tolkien.
Thunderbird / Citroen SM / Punto / BMW: Derek travels to the Lancashire coast to pick up a rare 1972 Citroen SM, and Dave admires a two-decade-old Punto with just 42 miles on the clock.
Ferrari Rep/Figaro/3 Tractors: Derek is on the road to pick up a funky little Nissan Figaro and a sublime Ferrari 250 GT tribute car, and Paul gets to try out his spanking new Scania T Cab.
German Aviation: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.
Men on the March: The complete story of World War I - from outbreak to conclusion - told through illuminating figures. Hear how an assassination brought conflict to Europe in 1914.
Castle Howard 2: Fiona Bruce presents from Castle Howard in North Yorkshire, where items brought in include a rare jade Buddha and a collection of First World War aviation paintings.
Britain and Ireland: Timothy West and Prunella Scales return to the Oxford Canal for a voyage through Cherwell Valley and recall their favourite waterway trips around the British Isles.

Lotus Carlton Turbo/TR7 Special Edition: Derek's winging his way to Bingley to meet a kindred spirit who's parting with his TR7 after 32 years. Paul and Charlie head to Anglesey to collect a pair of L
A team of treasure hunters, begin the hunt for a lost fortune in gold. Near a dry river-bed, they make an extraordinary discovery that proves they are on the right track.
Thunderbird / Citroen SM / Punto / BMW: Derek travels to the Lancashire coast to pick up a rare 1972 Citroen SM, and Dave admires a two-decade-old Punto with just 42 miles on the clock.
Ferrari Rep/Figaro/3 Tractors: Derek is on the road to pick up a funky little Nissan Figaro and a sublime Ferrari 250 GT tribute car, and Paul gets to try out his spanking new Scania T Cab.
Shadow of the Wars: Exploring a dystopian powerhouse in Pennsylvania, a fairy-tale castle in Poland, and Anglo-Saxon religious ruins across the vast plains of Scotland.
Death in Paradise: Exploring a bloody battleground on the Pacific Island of Peleliu and an ominous military stronghold in Russia.
German Aviation: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.
Shopping from Home.
Chicago to Champaign, Illinois: Michael Portillo travels from Chicago to Champaign, Illinois, visiting the Frank Lloyd Wright house that changed US architecture.
Illinois to Tennessee: Michael Portillo gets a taste of the early life of President Lincoln, learns about Samuel Langhorne Clemens, aka Mark Twain, and joins Elvis fans at Graceland.
DBS/Ford Escort RS2000: Derek's on his way to Blackpool to pick up what will be the highest-priced item at his next auction, but the 1970 Aston Martin DBS needs a tow to the local garage.
Ford Ranchero / Thames Truck: Derek has learnt to expect the unexpected over the years, so it's not a surprise when Call the Midwife star Cliff Parisi drops off his Bedford CA campervan.
Krupp: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.
Weapons of War: The story of World War I, told through revealing data. Around 25,000 miles of trenches were cut as the sides dug in and UK factories built 30,000 aircraft a year.
Helmingham Hall 1: Fiona Bruce presents from Helmingham Hall in Suffolk, where experts examine a medieval sword found in a pond, an Indian jewel and a collection of decorative boxes.
Black Country Living Museum 2: Fiona Bruce presents a second visit to the Black Country Living Museum, where items include one of the rarest guns featured on the show.

Mini Mayfair/NSU Quickly: In the 100th episode, Derek heads to Northumberland to collect a rare 1975 NSU RO 80, Jack deals with a Mini Mayfair stuck in a barn, and an Aston Martin DBS husk is auctione

Simon begins his journey on the island of Hispaniola and its two very different countries of the Dominican Republic - a tourist hotspot - and its poorer neighbour Haiti.
The Nicked Airmen: The bawdy wartime farce. When the British airmen are arrested paddling a tin bath down the estuary, Rene and co have to rescue them from the chateau - in coffins.
The Airmen De-Nicked: Hop over the channel for a rendezvous with Rene and his wartime chums. Using hijacked German uniforms, Michelle of the Resistance plans to infiltrate German HQ.
The Crooked Fences: Saucy wartime sitcom that's a big hit across Europe. Cafe Rene is the venue for a clandestine deal involving the infamous Fallen Madonna and a cuckoo clock weight.
